summary: Nancy P. Schultz was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). She appears in multiple payroll and certification reports from 1978 and 1979. These documents list her name, social security number, position, salary, and employment dates. The documents indicate she was employed by the SCAS during the period when they were actively investigating the JFK assassination.
significance: Nancy P. Schultz's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations, indicating her involvement in the investigation of the JFK assassination, although the specific nature and extent of her role are not detailed in these documents.
